condition.narrative: The PCU shall, not later than one (1) month after the Effective Date, (i) recruit and thereafter maintain, throughout the Projectimplementation period, (A) an environmental safeguards specialist; (B) a social safeguards specialist; (C) an information andcommunication technology specialist; (D) an international auditor; and (E) an accountant, and (ii) acquire a computerizedaccounting information system in accordance with Section I.A.4(b) of Schedule 2.

The PCU shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, recruit and thereafter maintain, throughout the Projectimplementation period, (i) an external auditor; (ii)five (5) regional accounting assistants; and (iii) five (5) regional internalcontrollers, in accordance with Section I.A.4(d) of Schedule 2.

The PCU shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, recruit and thereafter maintain, throughout the Projectimplementation period: (i) a monitoring and evaluation specialist; and (ii) two international fiduciary experts, each of whosequalifications, experience and terms of reference shall be acceptable to the Association, in accordance with Section 1.A.4(c) ofSchedule 2.

The Recipient shall ensure that the MPE and the MSE, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, recruit and/ordesignate focal points responsible for the coordination, with the Project Coordination Unit, of the following aspects of theProject: (i) procurement; (ii) monitoring and evaluation; (iii) financial management; (iv) accounting; and (vi) information andcommunications technology in accordance with Section 1.A.1 of Schedule 2.
The Recipient shall, not later than one (1) month after the effective date, establish a Project Steering Committee in accordancewith Section I.A.2(a) of Schedule 2.
The Recipient shall, not later than one (1) month after the effective date, establish a Project Technical Monitoring Committee, inaccordance with Section I.A.3(a)of Schedule 2.

The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, establish and thereafter maintain, throughout theProject implementation period, Regional Technical Support Units (“RTSUs”) in each of the five (5) deprived regions of Diffa,Maradi, Tahoua, Tillabéri and Zinder, to help ensure coordination of activities under Parts 1.2, 1.3, 2, and 3.1 of the Project atthe regional level, each with mandate, composition and resources satisfactory to the Association, as shall be further described inthe Project Implementation Manual, in accordance with Section 1.A.5 of Schedule 2.

The Recipient shall, not later than six (6) months after the Effective Date, recruit and thereafter maintain, throughout theProject implementation period, an external technical expert to act as an independent verifier, in accordance with Section I.E.1 ofSchedule 2.

title.narrative: National large-scale standardized learning assessments completed
Number of selected Makaranta schools that have signed an agreement with MOE
Number of basic education teachers participating in the new coaching activities
Out-of-school children and adolescents benefiting from direct interventions to support learning (disaggregated by general population, host communities and refugees)
Number of students benefiting from remedial programs at the primary and lower secondary level
Number of girls benefiting from the learning space initiative
Number of communities trained on verifying the use and implementation of school grants
Number of primary and lower secondary schools benefiting from a grant based on a signed performance agreement
Number of regional education authorities having achieved at least 80% of their PBC objectives
Students benefiting from direct interventions to enhance learning
Percentage of targeted inspectorates having achieved at least 80% of their PBC objectives
Primary and lower secondary schools benefiting from a performance grant and meeting the minimum requirements in terms of teaching and learning conditions
A national online education platform is established
Annual school census conducted through new digital tools and report produced
Classroom observation tools to assess teaching practices are established
Structured lessons are developed and digitized
A time-bound capacity-building and skills transfer implementation plan is established and implemented
New protocol on teacher deployment is established
Pedagogical and organizational audit conducted, and reports produced for ENIs and ENS
Increased percentage of targeted teachers in basic education demonstrating improved teaching practices in the classroom

target.value: 20 percentage points increase over the project lifetime

title.narrative: Percentage which remain enrolled in secondary school at the end of the year
